application.name: cnetcombinept
application.brief: Combine one to many control networks with common control points.

description.p: This program will create a control network by combining control points from one or more control networks into single points that satisfy either ground or image distance criteria. It employs a more robust technique than cnetmerge. This technique evaluates each control point in the combined network by applying a search of radial spatial distance (in meters) to collect all points that may be of the same feature. This search will find a list of candidate control points, i.e. points that the algorithm has found might be matches. Distance statistics of common control measures from the image are computed using the source point and each candidate control point. The MODE parameter for this program specifies the maximum distance, in IMAGE (pixel units) or GROUND (meter units), allowed to determine whether the two control points are measurements of the same image feature. If the average of all common measures is less than or equal to the distance (in the given IMAGE or GROUND units), then all control measures from the candidate control point are copied to the source control point (increasing image match depth) and the candidate control point is disabled so that it will never be considered for another merger. The now augmented control point is added back to the search pool for further merger considerations.
When all control points have been searched and all mergers have taken place, a new single combined control network is created.
Note that this application can be ran more than once and directly on the output of any past run (in other words, you need only provide a single network, if desired).

history.change: Uses modified ControlNet class which provides the ability to take ownership of all points in the control net efficiently. This is needed in order to ensure only a single copies of control points are utlized to minimize memory overhead.

parameter.name: CNETBASE
parameter.brief: Master control network file to match
parameter.description: The base control network file to which others will be matched.

parameter.name: CNETFROM
parameter.description: A control network that will be matched to the base (i.e. master) network.

parameter.name: CNETLIST
parameter.brief: List of merger control network files
parameter.description: A list of control network file names that will be matched to the base (i.e. master) network.

parameter.name: REFERENCE
parameter.brief: Cube file to use as a reference image for IMAGE mode
parameter.description: The reference cube for matching by image.

parameter.name: ONET
parameter.description: The output Control Network, which is the combined result of the input networks.

parameter.name: NETWORKID
parameter.brief: The NetworkId keyword value for the merged ControlNet
parameter.description: The NetworkId keyword for the newly merged ControlNet will be set to this given value. The Networkid is a single word identifier or name assigned to a Control Network.

parameter.name: DESCRIPTION
parameter.brief: The Description keyword value for the merged ControlNet
parameter.description: The Description keyword for the newly merged ControlNet will be set to this given value. This should be a brief description of the purpose of the merged control network.

parameter.name: MODE
parameter.brief: Type of control point merger to apply
parameter.description: The MODE parameter indicates whether to use ground or image coordinates to determine merge points.

option.brief: Use ground coordinates to determine merge points
option.description: Measure point distance in ground units (i.e. meters or kilometers).

option.brief: Use image coordinates from a specfied named reference cube
option.description: Measure point distance in pixel units.

parameter.name: DISTANCE
parameter.brief: Specifies the radial search distance for merge candidates
parameter.description: The radial search range from the source control point to find all candidate control points to consider for merging. This distance is specified in meters. Users must carefully consider this value as it must be large enough to include the maximum uncertainity in the SPICE ephemeris data for all images. Note if the adjusted latitude/longitude coordiate exists in the point, it will be used to determine the ground coordinate, otherwise apriori latitude/longitudes are used to compute distances from each control point. It also should not be so small that it will not find all the points of the same feature.

parameter.name: IMAGETOL
parameter.brief: Pixel distance tolerance to determine merge of point
parameter.description: The acceptable distance, in pixels, for merging points.

parameter.name: GROUNDTOL
parameter.brief: Specifies distance on ground to merge point if no common image measures .
parameter.description: The acceptable distance, in ground measurements, for merging points.

parameter.name: KDNODES
parameter.brief: Specify the leaf size of the kd-tree
parameter.description: Number of leafs in the kd-tree structure.

parameter.name: SETAPRIORIBEST
parameter.brief: Reset the apriori surface point to best available
parameter.description: When TRUE, all points apriori latitude/longitude surface point is updated to use the best one available. This is often the resulting coordinate after jigsaw has adjusted the surface point.

parameter.name: REJECTEDMEASURES
parameter.description: Determeines how to deal with rejected measures.

option.brief: Do not perform any action on non-normal measures
option.description: If selected, the program will leave rejected measures with their current settings.
If selected, the program will set rejected measures to Ignore.
If selected, the program will remove rejected measures from the control point.

parameter.name: MINMEASURES
parameter.brief: Select minimim number of measures that are valid
parameter.description: This allows users to disable (by setting measures as ignored) points that have less than MINMEASURES control measures/control point. For example, if you want to flag all points as ignored with 2 measures or less, set MINMEASURES=3.

parameter.name: SAVEMINS
parameter.brief: Save points that have less than the mininum measures
parameter.description: When TRUE, all points found to have the minimum number of measures are set to ignore and written to the output control network. When FALSE, they are excluded(removed) from the output network.
